comments.body: I don't understand the split between the two webserver.ts files.  Can you please explain?

webServer/webserver is common logic that can be used by our test harness so that we have tests when only few system functionality is implemented and how webserver session works with that. 
tsserver/webServer.ts is counter part of tsserve.js-> nodeServer(the current one which specializes tsserver.js specific changes) eg setting ts.sys to web system etc.
I bet the difference between `""` and `undefined` is important, but I can't tell how.
currentDirectory is suppose to be string and so it needs to return empty string.. we directory concatenate those strings so undefined would need too much checks i guess that was logic behind that.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +129,133 @@
            getExecutingFilePath: () => directorySeparator,
            getCurrentDirectory: returnEmptyString, // For inferred project root if projectRoot path is not set, normalizing the paths

            /* eslint-disable no-restricted-globals */

comments.body: These comments are for future system methods categorized so helpful to have them here sorted and will like to retain them.
